title: pilot-select component click not updating selection
description:
The pilot-select component is not properly updating the selected options when clicked. 

**Expected Behavior:**
- Clicking an option should update the selection state
- The trigger text should display the selected value(s)
- Change event should be dispatched
- For single-select: dropdown should close
- For multi-select: checkmarks should appear and selected tags should display

**Actual Behavior:**
- Clicking options does not update the selection
- The component appears unresponsive to clicks

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open demo.html in browser
2. Navigate to Select Components section
3. Click on any option in the dropdown
4. Observe that selection does not update

**Component Location:**
- File: design-system/components/select.js
- Custom Element: <pilot-select>

**Previous Attempt:**
A fix was applied to change _parseOptions() to query light DOM directly instead of using slot.assignedElements(), but the issue persists.

**Priority:** High - This is a core form component that is currently non-functional
close_reason: Fixed: The dropdown was closing synchronously in _selectOption(), destroying the shadow DOM before the click event could complete. Deferred the close with setTimeout to allow the event to finish processing.

title: BUG: Desktop nav items lack styling - appear as default links
description:
The navigation items in pilot-nav-menu component on desktop view have no styling applied. They appear as default browser links and lists instead of styled navigation items.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open demo.html in a browser
2. View at desktop width (> 768px)
3. Observe the navigation items in the pilot-nav-menu
4. Expected: Styled navigation items with proper typography, spacing, and hover states
5. Actual: Default browser link styling (blue underlined text, default list bullets)

Root Cause Analysis:
The slotchange event handler _processNavItems() should be adding CSS classes (nav-item, nav-link) to the slotted elements, but this may not be working due to:
1. Timing issues - slotchange may fire before the component is fully initialized
2. The re-render issue (same as pilot-hxs) - when render() is called, it may reset the slot content processing
3. The classes are being added to light DOM elements but the styles are in shadow DOM

Solution:
1. Fix the re-render issue first (see pilot-hxs)
2. Ensure _processNavItems runs correctly after initial render
3. Verify CSS selectors are targeting the right elements
4. Consider using CSS ::slotted() selector for styling slotted content

Note: The nested dropdown functionality is handled internally by the nav-menu component using _processNavItems and _processMobileNavItems methods with CSS and event handlers. No separate dropdown component is needed.

Files to modify:
- components/nav-menu.js

Priority: High - Visual appearance broken

title: pilot-select search input loses focus while typing
description:
The pilot-select component's search input still loses focus when typing in the search box, even after initial fix attempts.

## Problem
When typing in the searchable pilot-select dropdown's search box, the input loses focus on each keystroke, making it impossible to search effectively.

## Previous Attempts
- Added _isSearching flag to track focus state
- Modified attributeChangedCallback to skip re-rendering during search
- Refactored _filterOptions to only update options list
- Added focus/blur event listeners to search input

## Root Cause
The search input is being recreated/replaced during re-renders triggered by other code paths (option selection, dropdown state changes, etc.), causing focus loss even when _isSearching flag is set.

## Potential Solutions
1. Use a persistent DOM structure instead of innerHTML rebuilds
2. Store search input reference and restore focus after any render
3. Separate search input into its own component that doesn't re-render
4. Use a different approach: don't render search input via innerHTML, create it as a persistent element

## Affected File
- components/select.js

## Related
Original issue: pilot-qdt

title: BUG: Hamburger button click does not open mobile menu
description:
The hamburger button in pilot-nav-menu component is not functional. When clicked, the mobile menu should open but nothing happens.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open demo.html in a browser
2. Resize window to mobile width (< 768px) or use mobile view
3. Click the hamburger menu button
4. Expected: Mobile menu panel slides in
5. Actual: Nothing happens

Root Cause Analysis:
The issue is in the attributeChangedCallback method which calls render() for every attribute change. Since render() uses innerHTML to rebuild the entire shadow DOM, it destroys the event listeners attached by _attachEventListeners(). When the component initializes, attributeChangedCallback is triggered, causing a re-render that wipes out the hamburger button click listener.

Solution:
Follow the pattern used in pilot-toggle component:
- Only call render() for structural changes (breakpoint, variant, sticky)
- For the "open" attribute, use targeted updates (_openMenu/_closeMenu methods) instead of re-rendering
- This preserves event listeners and maintains component state

Files to modify:
- components/nav-menu.js

Priority: High - Core functionality broken

title: Fix input components re-rendering on key press causing focus loss
description:
Input components are losing focus on every key press because they are being fully re-rendered on user input. This is a performance issue and breaks user experience.

## Problem
When typing in input components (pilot-input, pilot-textarea, etc.), the component calls render() on every keystroke, which rebuilds the entire shadow DOM and causes the input to lose focus.

## Expected Behavior
Components should only update the necessary DOM elements on user input, not perform a full re-render.

## Affected Components
- pilot-input
- pilot-textarea  
- pilot-select
- Any other input-based components

## Solution
Refactor input components to use targeted updates instead of full re-renders when handling user input. Follow the pattern documented in AGENTS.md Performance section.

## References
See AGENTS.md section on 'Performance - Avoid Full Re-renders on User Input' for the correct pattern.
close_reason:
